X-Yahoo-Profile: gojomo

Looks like the culprit is ExtractorUniversal.isURLableChar(),
which does not include '_' (ascii 95). I've added it; unencoded
underscores are common in URIs.

A better solution could be an XML extractor, as covered by
RFE:

  [ 806831 ] XMLExtractor (XML/RSS)
  http://sourceforge.net/tracker/index.php?func=detail&aid=806831&group_id=73833&atid=539102

I've just checked in a dirt-simple ExtractorXML to CVS HEAD;
on my extremely limited testing, it does a good job of getting
URIs out of RSS XML. Please give it a try and let us know how
it works.

- Gordon @ IA

Bjarne Andersen wrote:
> Hi !
> 
> I would like to extract links from pages like this: (xml-files)
> http://podcast.dr.dk/p1/rssfeed/samfundstanker.xml
> 
> They are pretty straight foreward - but the only exctrator that will 
> grab these are the ExtractorUniversal.
> 
> That Extractor seems to not like '_' in URI's ??
> 
> that means that URI's like:
> Http://podcast.dr.dk/P1/SAMFUNDSTANKER/2005/SAMF_050925.mp3
> gets stripped to:
> Http://podcast.dr.dk/P1/SAMFUNDSTANKER/2005/SAMF
> 
> any comments / solutions ??
> 
> best
>
